author: Potter
text: This is a fierce bad Rabbit; look at his savage whiskers and his claws and his turned-up tail.

author: Potter
text: This is a nice gentle Rabbit.

author: Potter
text: His mother has given him a carrot.

author: Potter
text: The bad Rabbit would like some carrot.

author: Potter
text: And he scratches the good Rabbit very badly.

author: Potter
text: The good Rabbit creeps away and hides in a hole.

author: Potter
text: This is a man with a gun.

author: Potter
text: He sees something sitting on a bench.

author: Potter
text: He thinks it is a very funny bird!

author: Potter
text: He comes creeping up behind the trees.

author: Potter
text: But this is all he finds on the bench when he rushes up with his gun.

author: Potter
text: The good Rabbit peeps out of its hole . . .

author: Potter
text: . . . and it sees the bad Rabbit tearing past--without any tail or whiskers!
